contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|LM|lm}} The abbreviation '''LM''' or '''lm''' may refer to: {{TOC right}} ==Companies== * [[Legg Mason]], a U.S. investment management firm; NYSE ticker symbol * [[Livingston Energy Flight]], an Italian airline; IATA airline designator code * [[Lockheed Martin]], a U.S. defense contractor * [[London Midland]], a rail operator based in the West Midlands, England ==Economics and business studies== * [[IS/LM model]] in macroeconomics, where LM refers to Liquidity preference-Money supply * [[Lean manufacturing]] * [[Maltese lira]], the former currency of Malta ==Mathematics, science and statistics== * [[Lagrange multiplier]], a method for finding maxima and minima subject to constraints * [[Language model]], mathematical model used in language processing and speech recognition * [[Leonard-Merritt mass estimator]] * [[Levenberg–Marquardt algorithm]] * [[Lumen (unit)|Lumen]], unit of luminous flux ==Military== * [[Legion of Merit]], a United States military decoration ==Sport== * [[24 Hours of Le Mans]] race, and related car models * [[Late model]], a class of Racing car * [[Left midfielder]], a defensive position in association football ==Politics== * [[Liberal Movement (Australia)|Liberal Movement]], a defunct Australian political party ==Publishing== * ''[[Living Marxism]]'' magazine, published under the name ''LM'' between 1997 and 2000 * [[LM (magazine)]], a defunct British computer game magazine ==Technology== * [[Apollo Lunar Module]] spacecraft * [[LAN Manager]], a Microsoft network operating system * [[LM hash]], a Microsoft password hash function * [[Light meter]] * [[Light microscope]] * Line maintenance, a type of [[Aircraft maintenance checks]] * Linear Monolithic, a [[National Semiconductor]] prefix for their linear integrated circuits (e.g. LM324) * [[Long mode]], a CPU mode of operation where 64-bit programs are executed (''lm'' is also set as a CPU flag) ==Geography== * [[Lourenço Marques]], Pearl of the Indian Ocean, Mozambique * [[Lower Mainland]], a region in British Columbia, Canada ==Vehicle registration plate code== * [[Limburg-Weilburg]], Germany * [[Liptovský Mikuláš]], Slovakia * [[County Leitrim]], Ireland ==Other== * [[L&M]], a brand of cigarettes * [[Lower Merion High School]], a Pennsylvania secondary school == See also == * [[IM (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
